name: First Flush - På Tinden LP (afhentning i Insula)
description:
Preorder: 

Insula Music/First Flush, 

Release date: 9. januar. 2014


a1: Lykkeven
a2: Jordisk
a3: Brusende
b1: På tinden
b2: Brødre
b3: Største Fred

<q>Åbningsnummeret Lykkevens ømhed og spartanske instrumentering afløses af Jordisks gyngende dansevenlighed afbrudt af velplacerede og forløsende mellemstykker, der understreger First Flushs spændvidde og musikalitet, inden Brusende buldrer derudaf, anført af en skrigende, udsyret guitar der lyder som var den stjålet fra et Mainliner-nummer. B-siden fortsætter takterne med titelnummeret, der i et øjeblik sender tankerne mod Kliche inden en wah-pedal river enhver referenceramme ned, hvorefter sjæleren Brødre giver et afbræk inden Største freds pikrockguitar kombineret med sarte mellemspil igen flår lytterens forestillinger fra hinanden.

I et år kendetegnet ved et væld af interessante danske udgivelser og et opgør med alle genrekonventioner fremstår På tinden som en af de mest levende, rodløse og inspirerende plader."

Emil Thorenfelt. Passive aggressive. </q>

Læs mere her: 
<a>
http://passiveaggressive.dk/first-flush-blussende-kroppe-og-brusende-liv/ </a)

name: Seksuelle Mennesker - s/t LP
description:
Insula Music/Af Med Hovedet 

Stærk forsinket midt/slut januar.

A1-  Nøgen som guld
A2 - Titelnummer
A3 - Kærester
A4 - At være til 
A5 - Lig stille
B1 - Sport
B2 - Mørke på kanten af byen

Pladen er indspillet sommeren 2012 i Svendborg og København. 
Seksuelle Mennesker er Holger Hartvig og Lasse Latz. 
Frederik Larsen spiller trompet og synger kor.
Andrea Novel synger kor.

name: Synd og Skam - Center LP
description:
Escho, 2013. 

A1 Mærk Jeres Kroppe
A2 Kategori
A3 Op Ad Dine Lår
A4 Ind I Dit Kød
B1 De Hænder
B2 Rør Mig
B3 Skynd Dig Op Ad Trappen

Listen to the entire album

500 copies. 

Description
The smothering unpredictability of this magical everyday is transfixed in the crude free-punks' firm grip on the second chapter of Synd og Skam’s two-headed monster-debut Center. The record unfolds as culinary music à la pop-tarts, corned beef, dinosaur-soufflé and the spread of genital cracks. The ditch is monumental, the identity colorized.

name: Balkanhenning Og Hans Roekuleklappere LP
description:
"Balkanhenning og hans Roekuleklappere" was founded in 2008 by residents at "Gislegaard Kostskole for Oversete Talenter" in Denmark, a special needs group home and adult learning facility renowned for its music therapy courses.
To reach a larger audience, the band released their self-produced mp3-singles on various music websites, though very little ever came out of this.
Instead, they used the sites to raise funds for this LP release, consisting of home and studio recordings.

name: Tidsgæst 2LP
description:
Afd. O records, 2013

“Tidsgæst” er en hyldest til mysteriet. Alt det som ikke kan forklares, som skræmmer folk, som skubber til folks fastgroede verdensbilleder, alt det den etablerede videnskab ikke vil se eller høre om, og alt det som pusler i dit hus når du skal sove. Fortid, nutid, paralleltid og det som følger når tiderne blandes, fremtid og alternatid, er inspirationen og temaet for denne 86 min. lange dobbelt-LP.
Stilmæssigt er LP’en eksperimentel syrerock i stortset alle de undergenrer man kan forstille sig. Der er bizarre paranormale lydflader, alenlange hardpsych fuzz-smadr jams, svenskt spök-progg og SF/Berkeley inspirerede instrumentalnumre. Forstil dig hvordan sådan en en vinyl kunne lyde. Du er nok ikke langt fra sandheden.

Sigurd Djurhuus / Afd. O Records

name: Travelling Tribes - Everything Seems To Change (LP)
description:
Travelling Tribes - Everything Seems To Change (LP)

Two years ago the musician Emil Jensen travelled through West Africa. A dark night on a deserted beach in Gambia he experienced a wild and intense song sung by an elder African singer. The experience gave Emil a completely new understanding of the possibility in music to express passion; which sowed the seeds to Travelling Tribes.

This kind of ecstasy already influenced the percussion player Victor Dybbroe in his childhood in Bali, where he was overwhelmed by shadow plays accompanied by traditional Gamelan orchestras.

The desire to express the unexplainable experiences and feelings tie all the members of Travelling Tribes together when transcending genres from all around the globe on the album “Everything seems to change”. 

In a mix of unison singing, Chinese cello melodies, spherical keyboards, distorted African drums, polyphonic choir and noise guitar, the four musicians have created a sound that has been developed through the last year and a half.

“We have used ages to make the drums wail in the perfect way,” Emil Jensen laughs. “The goal has been to express a universal sound that can be recognized outside of the borders of Denmark”. The curiosity of the world has been returned and the band has been invited to play in the spring of 2013 at the Canadian Music Week and followed by a tour in the US.

Travelling Tribes exist of four comprehensive musicians from the underground music environment of Copenhagen. The musicians work with a.o. price receiving and nominated groups like Valby Vokalgruppe, Girls in Airports and The White Nothing. They have furthermore played and worked with musicians suchs as John Tchicai, Trentemøller, Clara Bryld and Soffie Viemose.

 
1. Spinning In Circles

2. Let’s Stay Together

3. VW

4. Feathers

5. Unheard Songs of Sorrow

6. Bon Voyage

7. Everything Seems to Change

8. Crisis

9. Rooftop

 

ILK
